channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump to address the affordability issue. And, Border Patrol heading to Charlotte

item.title: BBC apologizes for edit of Trump speech but says it won't provide legal compensation
item.description: The BBC has apologized to President Trump for the way it edited his Jan. 6, 2021 speech but says it won't pay compensation. Trump has threatened a $1 ...

item.title: Seizures, broken spines and vomiting: Scientific testing that helped facilitate D-Day
item.description: Biomedical engineer Rachel Lance says British scientists submitted themselves to experiments that would be considered unethical today. Her book is Cha...

item.title: The Trump administration plans major cuts to long-term housing for homelessness
item.description: The overhaul shifts funds to transitional housing requiring work and addiction treatment. The administration says it promotes "self-sufficiency," but ...

item.title: She criticized President Trump during the shutdown. Now she's been put on leave
item.description: Jenna Norton has spoken critically about the Trump administration's funding cuts and mass firings at the National Institutes of Health. At the end of ...

item.title: Emails reveal Epstein’s network of the rich and powerful despite sex offender status
Mass killings probe in Sudan will hold culprits to account, vows UN
item.description: "There has been too much pretence and performance, and too little action," says UN human rights chief Volker Türk.

item.title: She wanted to keep her son in his school district. It was more challenging than it seemed
item.description: When families are evicted, kids’ schooling is often disrupted. Many evicted families go from living in a school district that spends more money on stu...

item.title: Extended interview: Annie Lennox
item.description: Anthony Mason talks with Annie Lennox about her long-awaited visual memoir, "Annie Lennox: Retrospective," which is out now. She recounts the most thr...

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Green addresses Epstein files: "The government will not protect the predators"
item.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene speaks to "CBS Mornings" about the push to release the Epstein files. She was one of four Republicans that joined Democrat...

item.title: Greene says Trump's stance on Epstein files is "huge miscalculation"
item.description: Republican Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene told "CBS Mornings" that President Trump's opposition to releasing files from the federal investigation into co...

item.title: South Africa to investigate 'mystery' of planeload of Palestinians
item.description: It is not clear who chartered the plane carrying the Palestinians from Kenya to South Africa.

item.title: Remembering CBS News producer and video editor Seth Fox
item.description: The CBS News family is mourning the loss of producer and video editor Seth Fox. He leaves behind a wife and three children. He was 49.

item.title: 'Astonishingly lethal': BBC reports from site of Russian strike in Kyiv
item.description: The BBC's James Landale reports from the east of the capital where a drone struck a multi-storey residential building.

item.title: Some Cheetos and Doritos won't have their bright color anymore
item.description: New versions of Cheetos and Doritos, without artificial flavors or dyes, will be sold in December.

item.title: Several killed after bus crashes into Stockholm bus stop
item.description: Several others have have been injured in the crash in the Swedish capital, police say.

item.title: Call of Duty is back, and it's got a battle on its hands
item.description: The annual instalment of the massive series faces new challenges from competitor Battlefield 6.

item.title: New prosecutor to take on Georgia election case against Trump and others
